work/game-builder/src/cache/path-cache.js

path-cache.js

By Diego Enrique Marquez

Find me on Github

Inherits from:

Depends of:

A requireJS module. For use with Game-Builder

This module is very similar to image-cache, but instead of caching Images it caches paths drawn to a Canvas. Paths are quite taxing on the CPU, so drawing it once and then keeping the rastered image can be a pretty good time saver.

The module will cache dynamically generated canvases. A given canvas could then be used to draw onto it to cache a path for later use.

A few downsides are:

  1. If for whatever reason your path is going to change alot (ej. procedural animation), you are better not caching. Infact caching would be detrimental in this case.
  2. A width and a height for the rectangle enclosing the drawing need to be specified. This is because there is no easy way of determining the size of a path. A pretty small downside, but a downside non the less.
define(function(require) { var PathCache = require('cache').extend({

name

Returns a String
(The name of the cache)

name: function() { return 'Path Cache'; },

cache

Parameters:

  • id must be a String.
    (Id that will be used to retrieve the cached canvas)

  • width must be a Number.
    (Maximun width of the canvas to cache)

  • height must be a Number.
    (Maximun Height of the canvas to cache)

  • drawingFunction must be a Function.
    (Drawing commands to cache)

cache: function(id, width, height, drawingFunction) { var canvas = this.cacheObject[id]; if (!canvas) { canvas = document.createElement('canvas'); } canvas.width = width; canvas.height = height; var context = canvas.getContext('2d'); context.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height); drawingFunction(context); this.cacheObject[id] = canvas; this.execute(this.CACHE, this.cacheObject[id]); },

draw

This method does not clear the cached Canvas it just draws more things into it

Parameters:

  • id must be a String.
    (Id of a cached Canvas to draw to)

  • drawingFunction must be a Function.
    (Drawing to command to add on top of the cached canvas )

draw: function(id, drawingFunction) { var canvas = this.cacheObject[id]; if (!canvas) { return; } drawingFunction(canvas.getContext('2d')); this.execute(this.CACHE, this.cacheObject[id]); } }); return new PathCache(); });
